newsitem.title: ITALY: Gemina board member Pierri resigns - source.
newsitem.headline: Gemina board member Pierri resigns - source.

text.p: Paolo Pierri, one of the five members of the board of troubled Italian financial holding group Gemina, has resigned and will be replaced next month, a company source said on Tuesday.
It was not immediately clear why Pierri, a former manager at state-controlled telecoms holding company Stet who was appointed to Gemina's board in February, had quit.
Five former managers of Gemina were released last week into house arrest after they were detained on suspicion of false accounting.
Gemina's financial affairs have been under scrutiny after an investigation into alleged fraudulent book-keeping opened last year into the company and its RCS publishing division.
The company intends to hive off its industrial interests into a new company with Gemina keeping control of a few financial activities.
The company source said Pierri's succession was already on the agenda for Gemina's next cabinet meeting, due on November 27 or 28, which is scheduled to consider the company split.
